ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Apollo 14 ALSEP Electron and Proton Spectra, offline at NSSDC
ResourceHeader.Description: The data are 19.2-s count rates of electrons and protons at several energy steps between 40 eV and 20 keV.  Two electrostatic analyzers, each feeding 6 detectors, are oriented vertical from the lunar surface and 60 degrees from vertical, towards lunar west.

InformationURL.Name: HTTPS from SPDF (not with most browsers)

Parameter.Name: Count rates
Parameter.Description: Count rates of electrons and protons from each of two electrostatic analyzers, each of six detectors per analyzer, and each of 8 voltage steps for each 19.2 sec cycle
Parameter.Caveats: Occasionally (rarely?), the instrument was operated in a manual mode, when the cycle was 2.4 sec and voltages were not swept.

Structure.Description: 2 for electrostatic analyzers A and B, 6 for the 6 detector per electrostatic analyzer, 8 for the voltage steps per cycle.
